    Theory of topological modules and continuous linear maps. #

    We use the class ContinuousSMul for topological (semi) modules and topological vector spaces.

    In this file we define continuous (semi-)linear maps, as semilinear maps between topological modules which are continuous. The set of continuous semilinear maps between the topological R₁-module M and R₂-module M₂ with respect to the RingHom σ is denoted by M →SL[σ] M₂. Plain linear maps are denoted by M →L[R] M₂ and star-linear maps by M →L⋆[R] M₂.

    The corresponding notation for equivalences is M ≃SL[σ] M₂, M ≃L[R] M₂ and M ≃L⋆[R] M₂.

    source
    theorem ContinuousSMul.of_nhds_zero {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} [inst : Ring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : TopologicalRing R] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M] (hmul : Filter.Tendsto (fun p => p.fst • p.snd) (nhds 0 ×ˢ nhds 0) (nhds 0)) (hmulleft : ∀ (m : M), Filter.Tendsto (fun a => a • m) (nhds 0) (nhds 0)) (hmulright : ∀ (a : R), Filter.Tendsto (fun m => a • m) (nhds 0) (nhds 0)) :
    ContinuousSMul R M
    source
    theorem Submodule.eq_top_of_nonempty_interior' {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} [inst : Ring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousSMul R M] [inst : Filter.NeBot (nhdsWithin 0 {x | IsUnit x})] (s : Submodule R M) (hs : Set.Nonempty (interior ↑s)) :
    s = ⊤

    If M is a topological module over R and 0 is a limit of invertible elements of R, then ⊤ is the only submodule of M with a nonempty interior. This is the case, e.g., if R is a nontrivially normed field.

    source
    theorem Module.punctured_nhds_neBot (R : Type u_2) (M : Type u_1) [inst : Ring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousSMul R M] [inst : Nontrivial M] [inst : Filter.NeBot (nhdsWithin 0 {0}ᶜ)] [inst : NoZeroSMulDivisors R M] (x : M) :
    Filter.NeBot (nhdsWithin x {x}ᶜ)

    Let R be a topological ring such that zero is not an isolated point (e.g., a nontrivially normed field, see NormedField.punctured_nhds_neBot). Let M be a nontrivial module over R such that c • x = 0 implies c = 0 ∨ x = 0. Then M has no isolated points. We formulate this using NeBot (𝓝[≠] x).

    This lemma is not an instance because Lean would need to find [ContinuousSMul ?m_1 M] with unknown ?m_1. We register this as an instance for R = ℝ in Real.punctured_nhds_module_neBot. One can also use haveI := Module.punctured_nhds_neBot R M in a proof.

    source
    theorem continuousSMul_induced {R : Type u_1} {M₁ : Type u_2} {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M₁] [inst : Module R M₂] [u : TopologicalSpace R] {t : TopologicalSpace M₂} [inst : ContinuousSMul R M₂] (f : M₁ →ₗ[R] M₂) :
    ContinuousSMul R M₁
    source
    instance Submodule.continuousSMul {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace β] [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst : Semiring α] [inst : AddCommMonoid β] [inst : Module α β] [inst : ContinuousSMul α β] (S : Submodule α β) :
    ContinuousSMul α { x // x ∈ S }
    Equations
    • @Submodule.continuousSMul = @Submodule.continuousSMul.proof_1
    source
    instance Submodule.topologicalAddGroup {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace β] [inst : Ring α] [inst : AddCommGroup β] [inst : Module α β] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup β] (S : Submodule α β) :
    TopologicalAddGroup { x // x ∈ S }
    Equations
    • @Submodule.topologicalAddGroup = @Submodule.topologicalAddGroup.proof_1
    source
    theorem Submodule.mapsTo_smul_closure {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] (s : Submodule R M) (c : R) :
    Set.MapsTo (fun x => c • x) (closure ↑s) (closure ↑s)
    source
    theorem Submodule.smul_closure_subset {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] (s : Submodule R M) (c : R) :
    c • closure ↑s ⊆ closure ↑s
    source
    def Submodule.topologicalClosure {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] (s : Submodule R M) :
    Submodule R M

    The (topological-space) closure of a submodule of a topological R-module M is itself a submodule.

    Equations

    Instances For
      source
      @[simp]
      theorem Submodule.topologicalClosure_coe {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] (s : Submodule R M) :
      ↑(Submodule.topologicalClosure s) = closure ↑s
      source
      theorem Submodule.le_topologicalClosure {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] (s : Submodule R M) :
      s ≤ Submodule.topologicalClosure s
      source
      theorem Submodule.isClosed_topologicalClosure {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] (s : Submodule R M) :
      IsClosed ↑(Submodule.topologicalClosure s)
      source
      theorem Submodule.topologicalClosure_minimal {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] (s : Submodule R M) {t : Submodule R M} (h : s ≤ t) (ht : IsClosed ↑t) :
      Submodule.topologicalClosure s ≤ t
      source
      theorem Submodule.topologicalClosure_mono {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] {s : Submodule R M} {t : Submodule R M} (h : s ≤ t) :
      Submodule.topologicalClosure s ≤ Submodule.topologicalClosure t
      source
      theorem IsClosed.submodule_topologicalClosure_eq {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] {s : Submodule R M} (hs : IsClosed ↑s) :
      Submodule.topologicalClosure s = s

      The topological closure of a closed submodule s is equal to s.

      source
      theorem Submodule.dense_iff_topologicalClosure_eq_top {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] {s : Submodule R M} :
      Dense ↑s ↔ Submodule.topologicalClosure s = ⊤

      A subspace is dense iff its topological closure is the entire space.

      source
      instance Submodule.topologicalClosure.completeSpace {R : Type u} [inst : Semiring R] {M' : Type u_1} [inst : AddCommMonoid M'] [inst : Module R M'] [inst : UniformSpace M'] [inst : ContinuousAdd M'] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M'] [inst : CompleteSpace M'] (U : Submodule R M') :
      CompleteSpace { x // x ∈ Submodule.topologicalClosure U }
      Equations
      • @Submodule.topologicalClosure.completeSpace = @Submodule.topologicalClosure.completeSpace.proof_1
      source
      theorem Submodule.isClosed_or_dense_of_isCoatom {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] (s : Submodule R M) (hs : IsCoatom s) :
      IsClosed ↑s ∨ Dense ↑s

      A maximal proper subspace of a topological module (i.e a Submodule satisfying IsCoatom) is either closed or dense.

      source
      theorem LinearMap.continuous_on_pi {ι : Type u_1} {R : Type u_2} {M : Type u_3} [inst : Finite ι] [inst : Semiring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace R] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M] [inst : ContinuousSMul R M] (f : (ι → R) →ₗ[R] M) :
      Continuous ↑f
      source
      structure ContinuousLinearMap {R : Type u_1} {S : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : Semiring S] (σ : R →+* S) (M : Type u_3) [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] (M₂ : Type u_4) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module S M₂] extends LinearMap :
      Type (maxu_3u_4)

      • Continuous linear maps between modules. We only put the type classes that are necessary for the definition, although in applications M and M₂ will be topological modules over the topological ring R.

        cont : autoParam (Continuous toLinearMap.toFun) _auto✝

      Continuous linear maps between modules. We only put the type classes that are necessary for the definition, although in applications M and M₂ will be topological modules over the topological ring R.

      Instances For
        source
        def «term_→SL[_]_» :
        Lean.TrailingParserDescr

            Instances For
              source
              class ContinuousSemilinearMapClass (F : Type u_1) {R : outParam (Type u_2)} {S : outParam (Type u_3)} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : Semiring S] (σ : outParam (R →+* S)) (M : outParam (Type u_4)) [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] (M₂ : outParam (Type u_5)) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module S M₂] extends SemilinearMapClass :
              Type (max(maxu_1u_4)u_5)

              • Continuity

                map_continuous : ∀ (f : F), Continuous ↑f

              ContinuousSemilinearMapClass F σ M M₂ asserts F is a type of bundled continuous σ-semilinear maps M → M₂. See also ContinuousLinearMapClass F R M M₂ for the case where σ is the identity map on R. A map f between an R-module and an S-module over a ring homomorphism σ : R →+* S is semilinear if it satisfies the two properties f (x + y) = f x + f y and f (c • x) = (σ c) • f x.

              Instances
                source
                @[inline]
                abbrev ContinuousLinearMapClass (F : Type u_1) (R : outParam (Type u_2)) [inst : Semiring R] (M : outParam (Type u_3)) [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] (M₂ : outParam (Type u_4)) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R M₂] :
                Type (max(maxu_1u_3)u_4)

                ContinuousLinearMapClass F R M M₂ asserts F is a type of bundled continuous R-linear maps M → M₂. This is an abbreviation for ContinuousSemilinearMapClass F (RingHom.id R) M M₂.

                Equations
                • ContinuousLinearMapClass F R M M₂ = ContinuousSemilinearMapClass F (RingHom.id R) M M₂
                Instances For
                  source
                  structure ContinuousLinearEquiv {R : Type u_1} {S : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : Semiring S] (σ : R →+* S) {σ' : S →+* R} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ σ'] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ' σ] (M : Type u_3) [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] (M₂ : Type u_4) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module S M₂] extends LinearEquiv :
                  Type (maxu_3u_4)

                  • Continuous linear equivalences between modules. We only put the type classes that are necessary for the definition, although in applications M and M₂ will be topological modules over the topological semiring R.

                    continuous_toFun : autoParam (Continuous toLinearEquiv.toFun) _auto✝

                    continuous_invFun : autoParam (Continuous toLinearEquiv.invFun) _auto✝

                          • ContinuousSemilinearEquivClass F σ M M₂ asserts F is a type of bundled continuous σ-semilinear equivs M → M₂. See also ContinuousLinearEquivClass F R M M₂ for the case where σ is the identity map on R. A map f between an R-module and an S-module over a ring homomorphism σ : R →+* S is semilinear if it satisfies the two properties f (x + y) = f x + f y and f (c • x) = (σ c) • f x.

                            map_continuous : autoParam (∀ (f : F), Continuous ↑f) _auto✝

                          • ContinuousSemilinearEquivClass F σ M M₂ asserts F is a type of bundled continuous σ-semilinear equivs M → M₂. See also ContinuousLinearEquivClass F R M M₂ for the case where σ is the identity map on R. A map f between an R-module and an S-module over a ring homomorphism σ : R →+* S is semilinear if it satisfies the two properties f (x + y) = f x + f y and f (c • x) = (σ c) • f x.

                            inv_continuous : autoParam (∀ (f : F), Continuous (EquivLike.inv f)) _auto✝

                          ContinuousSemilinearEquivClass F σ M M₂ asserts F is a type of bundled continuous σ-semilinear equivs M → M₂. A map f between an R-module and an S-module over a ring homomorphism σ : R →+* S is semilinear if it satisfies the two properties f (x + y) = f x + f y and f (c • x) = (σ c) • f x.

                                        ↑f (c • x) = ↑σ₁₂ c • ↑f x

                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.map_smul {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] (f : M₁ →L[R₁] M₂) (c : R₁) (x : M₁) :
                                        ↑f (c • x) = c • ↑f x
                                        source
                                        @[simp]
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.map_smul_of_tower {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {R : Type u_1} {S : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring S] [inst : SMul R M₁] [inst : Module S M₁] [inst : SMul R M₂] [inst : Module S M₂] [inst : LinearMap.CompatibleSMul M₁ M₂ R S] (f : M₁ →L[S] M₂) (c : R) (x : M₁) :
                                        ↑f (c • x) = c • ↑f x
                                        source
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.map_sum {R₁ : Type u_2} {R₂ : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] {ι : Type u_1} (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (s : Finset ι) (g : ι → M₁) :
                                        ↑f (Finset.sum s fun i => g i) = Finset.sum s fun i => ↑f (g i)
                                        source
                                        @[simp]
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_coe {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) :
                                        ↑↑f = ↑f
                                        source
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.ext_ring {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] {f : R₁ →L[R₁] M₁} {g : R₁ →L[R₁] M₁} (h : ↑f 1 = ↑g 1) :
                                        f = g
                                        source
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.ext_ring_iff {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] {f : R₁ →L[R₁] M₁} {g : R₁ →L[R₁] M₁} :
                                        f = g ↔ ↑f 1 = ↑g 1
                                        source
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.eqOn_closure_span {R₁ : Type u_3} {R₂ : Type u_4} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : T2Space M₂] {s : Set M₁} {f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂} {g : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂} (h : Set.EqOn (↑f) (↑g) s) :
                                        Set.EqOn (↑f) (↑g) (closure ↑(Submodule.span R₁ s))

                                        If two continuous linear maps are equal on a set s, then they are equal on the closure of the Submodule.span of this set.

                                        source
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.ext_on {R₁ : Type u_3} {R₂ : Type u_4} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : T2Space M₂] {s : Set M₁} (hs : Dense ↑(Submodule.span R₁ s)) {f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂} {g : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂} (h : Set.EqOn (↑f) (↑g) s) :
                                        f = g

                                        If the submodule generated by a set s is dense in the ambient module, then two continuous linear maps equal on s are equal.

                                        source
                                        theorem Submodule.topologicalClosure_map {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : RingHomSurjective σ₁₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₂] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₁ M₁] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₂] (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (s : Submodule R₁ M₁) :
                                        Submodule.map (↑f) (Submodule.topologicalClosure s) ≤ Submodule.topologicalClosure (Submodule.map (↑f) s)

                                        Under a continuous linear map, the image of the TopologicalClosure of a submodule is contained in the TopologicalClosure of its image.

                                        source
                                        theorem DenseRange.topologicalClosure_map_submodule {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : RingHomSurjective σ₁₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₂] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₁ M₁] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₂] {f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂} (hf' : DenseRange ↑f) {s : Submodule R₁ M₁} (hs : Submodule.topologicalClosure s = ⊤) :
                                        Submodule.topologicalClosure (Submodule.map (↑f) s) = ⊤

                                        Under a dense continuous linear map, a submodule whose TopologicalClosure is ⊤ is sent to another such submodule. That is, the image of a dense set under a map with dense range is dense.

                                        source
                                        instance ContinuousLinearMap.mulAction {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] {S₂ : Type u_5} [inst : Monoid S₂] [inst : DistribMulAction S₂ M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass R₂ S₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul S₂ M₂] :
                                        MulAction S₂ (M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂)
                                        Equations
                                        • ContinuousLinearMap.mulAction = MulAction.mk (_ : ∀ (_f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂), 1 • _f = _f) (_ : ∀ (_a _b : S₂) (_f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂), (_a * _b) • _f = _a • _b • _f)
                                        source
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.smul_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] {S₂ : Type u_5} [inst : Monoid S₂] [inst : DistribMulAction S₂ M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass R₂ S₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul S₂ M₂] (c : S₂) (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (x : M₁) :
                                        ↑(c • f) x = c • ↑f x
                                        source
                                        @[simp]
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_smul {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] {S₂ : Type u_5} [inst : Monoid S₂] [inst : DistribMulAction S₂ M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass R₂ S₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul S₂ M₂] (c : S₂) (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) :

                                        instance ContinuousLinearMap.isScalarTower {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] {S₂ : Type u_5} {T₂ : Type u_6} [inst : Monoid S₂] [inst : Monoid T₂] [inst : DistribMulAction S₂ M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass R₂ S₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul S₂ M₂] [inst : DistribMulAction T₂ M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass R₂ T₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul T₂ M₂] [inst : SMul S₂ T₂] [inst : IsScalarTower S₂ T₂ M₂] :

                                        instance ContinuousLinearMap.zero {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] :
                                        Zero (M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂)

                                        The continuous map that is constantly zero.

                                        Equations
                                        • ContinuousLinearMap.zero = { zero := ContinuousLinearMap.mk 0 }
                                        source
                                        instance ContinuousLinearMap.inhabited {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] :
                                        Inhabited (M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂)
                                        Equations
                                        • ContinuousLinearMap.inhabited = { default := 0 }
                                        source

                                        instance ContinuousLinearMap.uniqueOfLeft {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : Subsingleton M₁] :
                                        Unique (M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂)
                                        Equations
                                        • ContinuousLinearMap.uniqueOfLeft = Function.Injective.unique (_ : Function.Injective ContinuousLinearMap.toLinearMap)
                                        source
                                        instance ContinuousLinearMap.uniqueOfRight {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : Subsingleton M₂] :
                                        Unique (M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂)
                                        Equations
                                        • ContinuousLinearMap.uniqueOfRight = Function.Injective.unique (_ : Function.Injective ContinuousLinearMap.toLinearMap)
                                        source
                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.exists_ne_zero {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] {f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂} (hf : f ≠ 0) :
                                        ∃ x, ↑f x ≠ 0
                                        source
                                        def ContinuousLinearMap.id (R₁ : Type u_1) [inst : Semiring R₁] (M₁ : Type u_2) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] :
                                        M₁ →L[R₁] M₁

                                        the identity map as a continuous linear map.

                                        Equations
                                        • ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ M₁ = ContinuousLinearMap.mk LinearMap.id
                                        Instances For
                                          source
                                          instance ContinuousLinearMap.one {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] :
                                          One (M₁ →L[R₁] M₁)
                                          Equations
                                          • ContinuousLinearMap.one = { one := ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ M₁ }
                                          source
                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.one_def {R₁ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] :
                                          1 = ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ M₁
                                          source
                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.id_apply {R₁ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] (x : M₁) :
                                          ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ M₁) x = x
                                          source
                                          @[simp]
                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_id {R₁ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] :
                                          ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ M₁) = LinearMap.id
                                          source
                                          @[simp]
                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_id' {R₁ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] :
                                          ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ M₁) = id
                                          source
                                          @[simp]
                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_eq_id {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] {f : M₁ →L[R₁] M₁} :
                                          ↑f = LinearMap.id ↔ f = ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ M₁
                                          source
                                          @[simp]
                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.one_apply {R₁ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] (x : M₁) :
                                          ↑1 x = x
                                          source
                                          instance ContinuousLinearMap.add {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₂] :
                                          Add (M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂)
                                          Equations
                                          • ContinuousLinearMap.add = { add := fun f g => ContinuousLinearMap.mk (↑f + ↑g) }
                                          source
                                          @[simp]
                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.add_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₂] (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (g : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (x : M₁) :
                                          ↑(f + g) x = ↑f x + ↑g x
                                          source
                                          @[simp]
                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_add {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₂] (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (g : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) :
                                          ↑(f + g) = ↑f + ↑g
                                          source
                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_add' {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₂] (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (g : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) :
                                          ↑(f + g) = ↑f + ↑g
                                          source
                                          instance ContinuousLinearMap.addCommMonoid {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₂] :
                                          AddCommMonoid (M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂)
                                          Equations
                                          • ContinuousLinearMap.addCommMonoid = AddCommMonoid.mk (_ : ∀ (a b : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂), a + b = b + a)
                                          source
                                          @[simp]

                                          ↑(Finset.sum t fun d => f d) = Finset.sum t fun d => ↑(f d)

                                              Equations

                                                def ContinuousLinearMap.prod {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₃] (f₁ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₂) (f₂ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₃) :
                                                M₁ →L[R₁] M₂ × M₃

                                                The cartesian product of two bounded linear maps, as a bounded linear map.

                                                Equations
                                                • ContinuousLinearMap.prod f₁ f₂ = ContinuousLinearMap.mk (LinearMap.prod ↑f₁ ↑f₂)
                                                Instances For
                                                  source
                                                  @[simp]
                                                  theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_prod {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₃] (f₁ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₂) (f₂ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₃) :
                                                  ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.prod f₁ f₂) = LinearMap.prod ↑f₁ ↑f₂
                                                  source
                                                  @[simp]
                                                  theorem ContinuousLinearMap.prod_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₃] (f₁ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₂) (f₂ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₃) (x : M₁) :
                                                  ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.prod f₁ f₂) x = (↑f₁ x, ↑f₂ x)
                                                  source
                                                  def ContinuousLinearMap.inl (R₁ : Type u_1) [inst : Semiring R₁] (M₁ : Type u_2) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] (M₂ : Type u_3) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] :
                                                  M₁ →L[R₁] M₁ × M₂

                                                  The left injection into a product is a continuous linear map.

                                                  Equations
                                                  • ContinuousLinearMap.inl R₁ M₁ M₂ = ContinuousLinearMap.prod (ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ M₁) 0
                                                  Instances For
                                                    source
                                                    def ContinuousLinearMap.inr (R₁ : Type u_1) [inst : Semiring R₁] (M₁ : Type u_2) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] (M₂ : Type u_3) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] :
                                                    M₂ →L[R₁] M₁ × M₂

                                                    The right injection into a product is a continuous linear map.

                                                    Equations
                                                    • ContinuousLinearMap.inr R₁ M₁ M₂ = ContinuousLinearMap.prod 0 (ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ M₂)
                                                    Instances For
                                                      source
                                                      @[simp]
                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.inl_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] (x : M₁) :
                                                      ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.inl R₁ M₁ M₂) x = (x, 0)
                                                      source
                                                      @[simp]
                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.inr_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] (x : M₂) :
                                                      ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.inr R₁ M₁ M₂) x = (0, x)

                                                      LinearMap.ker (ContinuousLinearMap.prod f g) = LinearMap.ker f ⊓ LinearMap.ker g

                                                      def ContinuousLinearMap.codRestrict {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (p : Submodule R₂ M₂) (h : ∀ (x : M₁), ↑f x ∈ p) :
                                                      M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] { x // x ∈ p }

                                                                def ContinuousLinearMap.coprod {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₃] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₃] (f₁ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₃) (f₂ : M₂ →L[R₁] M₃) :
                                                                M₁ × M₂ →L[R₁] M₃

                                                                The continuous linear map given by (x, y) ↦ f₁ x + f₂ y.

                                                                Equations
                                                                • ContinuousLinearMap.coprod f₁ f₂ = ContinuousLinearMap.mk (LinearMap.coprod ↑f₁ ↑f₂)

                                                                  @[simp]
                                                                  theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_coprod {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₃] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₃] (f₁ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₃) (f₂ : M₂ →L[R₁] M₃) :
                                                                  ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.coprod f₁ f₂) = LinearMap.coprod ↑f₁ ↑f₂
                                                                  source
                                                                  @[simp]
                                                                  theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coprod_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₃] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₃] (f₁ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₃) (f₂ : M₂ →L[R₁] M₃) (x : M₁ × M₂) :
                                                                  ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.coprod f₁ f₂) x = ↑f₁ x.fst + ↑f₂ x.snd
                                                                  source
                                                                  theorem ContinuousLinearMap.range_coprod {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₃] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₃] (f₁ : M₁ →L[R₁] M₃) (f₂ : M₂ →L[R₁] M₃) :
                                                                  LinearMap.range (ContinuousLinearMap.coprod f₁ f₂) = LinearMap.range f₁ ⊔ LinearMap.range f₂
                                                                  source
                                                                  theorem ContinuousLinearMap.comp_fst_add_comp_snd {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₃] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₃] (f : M₁ →L[R₁] M₃) (g : M₂ →L[R₁] M₃) :
                                                                  ContinuousLinearMap.comp f (ContinuousLinearMap.fst R₁ M₁ M₂) + ContinuousLinearMap.comp g (ContinuousLinearMap.snd R₁ M₁ M₂) = ContinuousLinearMap.coprod f g
                                                                  source
                                                                  theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coprod_inl_inr {R₁ : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M'₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M'₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M'₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M'₁] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₁] [inst : ContinuousAdd M'₁] :
                                                                  ContinuousLinearMap.coprod (ContinuousLinearMap.inl R₁ M₁ M'₁) (ContinuousLinearMap.inr R₁ M₁ M'₁) = ContinuousLinearMap.id R₁ (M₁ × M'₁)
                                                                  source
                                                                  def ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight {M₁ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {R : Type u_3} {S : Type u_4} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : Semiring S] [inst : Module R M₁] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : Module R S] [inst : Module S M₂] [inst : IsScalarTower R S M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace S] [inst : ContinuousSMul S M₂] (c : M₁ →L[R] S) (f : M₂) :
                                                                  M₁ →L[R] M₂

                                                                  The linear map fun x => c x • f. Associates to a scalar-valued linear map and an element of M₂ the M₂-valued linear map obtained by multiplying the two (a.k.a. tensoring by M₂). See also ContinuousLinearMap.smulRightₗ and ContinuousLinearMap.smulRightL.

                                                                  Equations
                                                                  • One or more equations did not get rendered due to their size.
                                                                  Instances For
                                                                    source
                                                                    @[simp]
                                                                    theorem ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight_apply {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {R : Type u_1} {S : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : Semiring S] [inst : Module R M₁] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : Module R S] [inst : Module S M₂] [inst : IsScalarTower R S M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace S] [inst : ContinuousSMul S M₂] {c : M₁ →L[R] S} {f : M₂} {x : M₁} :
                                                                    ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight c f) x = ↑c x • f
                                                                    source
                                                                    @[simp]
                                                                    theorem ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight_one_one {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₁ M₂] (c : R₁ →L[R₁] M₂) :
                                                                    ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight 1 (↑c 1) = c
                                                                    source
                                                                    @[simp]
                                                                    theorem ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight_one_eq_iff {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₁ M₂] {f : M₂} {f' : M₂} :
                                                                    ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight 1 f = ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight 1 f' ↔ f = f'
                                                                    source
                                                                    theorem ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight_comp {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₁ M₂] [inst : ContinuousMul R₁] {x : M₂} {c : R₁} :
                                                                    ContinuousLinearMap.comp (ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight 1 x) (ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight 1 c) = ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight 1 (c • x)
                                                                    source
                                                                    def ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton (R₁ : Type u_1) [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₁ M₁] (x : M₁) :
                                                                    R₁ →L[R₁] M₁

                                                                    Given an element x of a topological space M over a semiring R, the natural continuous linear map from R to M by taking multiples of x.

                                                                    Equations
                                                                    • ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton R₁ x = ContinuousLinearMap.mk (LinearMap.toSpanSingleton R₁ M₁ x)
                                                                    Instances For
                                                                      source
                                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton_apply (R₁ : Type u_2) [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₁ M₁] (x : M₁) (r : R₁) :
                                                                      ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton R₁ x) r = r • x
                                                                      source
                                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton_add (R₁ : Type u_2) [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₁ M₁] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₁] (x : M₁) (y : M₁) :
                                                                      ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton R₁ (x + y) = ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton R₁ x + ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton R₁ y
                                                                      source
                                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton_smul' (R₁ : Type u_3) [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R₁ M₁] {α : Type u_1} [inst : Monoid α] [inst : DistribMulAction α M₁] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul α M₁] [inst : SMulCommClass R₁ α M₁] (c : α) (x : M₁) :
                                                                      ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton R₁ (c • x) = c • ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton R₁ x
                                                                      source
                                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton_smul (R : Type u_1) {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : CommSemiring R] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R M₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : ContinuousSMul R M₁] (c : R) (x : M₁) :
                                                                      ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton R (c • x) = c • ContinuousLinearMap.toSpanSingleton R x

                                                                      A special case of to_span_singleton_smul' for when R is commutative.

                                                                      source
                                                                      def ContinuousLinearMap.pi {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] {ι : Type u_3} {φ : ι → Type u_4} [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] (f : (i : ι) → M →L[R] φ i) :
                                                                      M →L[R] (i : ι) → φ i

                                                                      pi construction for continuous linear functions. From a family of continuous linear functions it produces a continuous linear function into a family of topological modules.

                                                                      Equations
                                                                      • ContinuousLinearMap.pi f = ContinuousLinearMap.mk (LinearMap.pi fun i => ↑(f i))
                                                                      Instances For
                                                                        source
                                                                        @[simp]
                                                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_pi' {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] {ι : Type u_4} {φ : ι → Type u_3} [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] (f : (i : ι) → M →L[R] φ i) :
                                                                        ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.pi f) = fun c i => ↑(f i) c
                                                                        source
                                                                        @[simp]
                                                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_pi {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] {ι : Type u_4} {φ : ι → Type u_3} [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] (f : (i : ι) → M →L[R] φ i) :
                                                                        ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.pi f) = LinearMap.pi fun i => ↑(f i)
                                                                        source
                                                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.pi_apply {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] {ι : Type u_4} {φ : ι → Type u_3} [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] (f : (i : ι) → M →L[R] φ i) (c : M) (i : ι) :
                                                                        ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.pi f) c i = ↑(f i) c
                                                                        source
                                                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.pi_eq_zero {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] {ι : Type u_4} {φ : ι → Type u_3} [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] (f : (i : ι) → M →L[R] φ i) :
                                                                        ContinuousLinearMap.pi f = 0 ↔ ∀ (i : ι), f i = 0
                                                                        source
                                                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.pi_zero {R : Type u_4} [inst : Semiring R] {M : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] {ι : Type u_2} {φ : ι → Type u_3} [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] :
                                                                        (ContinuousLinearMap.pi fun x => 0) = 0

                                                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.pi_comp {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] {ι : Type u_5} {φ : ι → Type u_3} [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] (f : (i : ι) → M →L[R] φ i) (g : M₂ →L[R] M) :
                                                                        ContinuousLinearMap.comp (ContinuousLinearMap.pi f) g = ContinuousLinearMap.pi fun i => ContinuousLinearMap.comp (f i) g

                                                                        def ContinuousLinearMap.proj {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] {ι : Type u_2} {φ : ι → Type u_3} [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] (i : ι) :
                                                                        ((i : ι) → φ i) →L[R] φ i

                                                                        The projections from a family of topological modules are continuous linear maps.

                                                                        Equations
                                                                        • ContinuousLinearMap.proj i = ContinuousLinearMap.mk (LinearMap.proj i)
                                                                        Instances For

                                                                          ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.proj i) b = b i

                                                                          ContinuousLinearMap.comp (ContinuousLinearMap.proj i) (ContinuousLinearMap.pi f) = f i

                                                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.iInf_ker_proj {R : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R] {ι : Type u_1} {φ : ι → Type u_2} [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] :
                                                                          ⨅ (i : ι), LinearMap.ker (ContinuousLinearMap.proj i) = ⊥
                                                                          source
                                                                          def ContinuousLinearMap.iInfKerProjEquiv (R : Type u_1) [inst : Semiring R] {ι : Type u_2} (φ : ι → Type u_3) [inst : (i : ι) → TopologicalSpace (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → AddCommMonoid (φ i)] [inst : (i : ι) → Module R (φ i)] {I : Set ι} {J : Set ι} [inst : DecidablePred fun i => i ∈ I] (hd : Disjoint I J) (hu : Set.univ ⊆ I ∪ J) :
                                                                          { x // x ∈ ⨅ (i : ι) (_ : i ∈ J), LinearMap.ker (ContinuousLinearMap.proj i) } ≃L[R] (i : ↑I) → φ ↑i

                                                                          If I and J are complementary index sets, the product of the kernels of the Jth projections of φ is linearly equivalent to the product over I.

                                                                          Equations
                                                                          • ContinuousLinearMap.iInfKerProjEquiv R φ hd hu = ContinuousLinearEquiv.mk (LinearMap.iInfKerProjEquiv R φ hd hu)
                                                                          Instances For
                                                                            source

                                                                            ContinuousLinearMap.comp (-g) f = -ContinuousLinearMap.comp g f
                                                                            source
                                                                            @[simp]
                                                                            theorem ContinuousLinearMap.comp_sub {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Ring R₂] {R₃ : Type u_3} [inst : Ring R₃] {M : Type u_6} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] {M₃ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommGroup M₃] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : Module R₃ M₃] {σ₁₂ : R →+* R₂} {σ₂₃ : R₂ →+* R₃} {σ₁₃ : R →+* R₃} [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₁₂ σ₂₃ σ₁₃] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M₂] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M₃] (g : M₂ →SL[σ₂₃] M₃) (f₁ : M →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (f₂ : M →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) :
                                                                            ContinuousLinearMap.comp g (f₁ - f₂) = ContinuousLinearMap.comp g f₁ - ContinuousLinearMap.comp g f₂

                                                                            theorem ContinuousLinearMap.sub_comp {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Ring R₂] {R₃ : Type u_3} [inst : Ring R₃] {M : Type u_6} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] {M₂ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] {M₃ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommGroup M₃] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : Module R₃ M₃] {σ₁₂ : R →+* R₂} {σ₂₃ : R₂ →+* R₃} {σ₁₃ : R →+* R₃} [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₁₂ σ₂₃ σ₁₃] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M₃] (g₁ : M₂ →SL[σ₂₃] M₃) (g₂ : M₂ →SL[σ₂₃] M₃) (f : M →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) :
                                                                            ContinuousLinearMap.comp (g₁ - g₂) f = ContinuousLinearMap.comp g₁ f - ContinuousLinearMap.comp g₂ f

                                                                            instance ContinuousLinearMap.ring {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M] :
                                                                            Ring (M →L[R] M)
                                                                            Equations
                                                                            • ContinuousLinearMap.ring = let src := ContinuousLinearMap.semiring; let src_1 := ContinuousLinearMap.addCommGroup; Ring.mk SubNegMonoid.zsmul (_ : ∀ (a : M →L[R] M), -a + a = 0)
                                                                            source
                                                                            theorem ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight_one_pow {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] [inst : TopologicalSpace R] [inst : TopologicalRing R] (c : R) (n : ℕ) :
                                                                            ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight 1 c ^ n = ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight 1 (c ^ n)
                                                                            source
                                                                            def ContinuousLinearMap.projKerOfRightInverse {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Ring R₂] {M : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] {σ₁₂ : R →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M] (f₁ : M →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (f₂ : M₂ →SL[σ₂₁] M) (h : Function.RightInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) :
                                                                            M →L[R] { x // x ∈ LinearMap.ker f₁ }

                                                                            Given a right inverse f₂ : M₂ →L[R] M to f₁ : M →L[R] M₂, projKerOfRightInverse f₁ f₂ h is the projection M →L[R] LinearMap.ker f₁ along LinearMap.range f₂.

                                                                              instance ContinuousLinearMap.distribMulAction {R : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} {S₃ : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : Semiring R₂] [inst : Monoid S₃] {M : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] {M₂ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] {σ₁₂ : R →+* R₂} [inst : DistribMulAction S₃ M₂] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul S₃ M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass R₂ S₃ M₂] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₂] :
                                                                              DistribMulAction S₃ (M →SL[σ₁₂] M₂)
                                                                              Equations
                                                                              • ContinuousLinearMap.distribMulAction = DistribMulAction.mk (_ : ∀ (_a : S₃), _a • 0 = 0) (_ : ∀ (a : S₃) (f g : M →SL[σ₁₂] M₂), a • (f + g) = a • f + a • g)

                                                                                instance ContinuousLinearMap.module {R : Type u_1} {R₃ : Type u_2} {S₃ : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : Semiring R₃] [inst : Semiring S₃] {M : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] {M₃ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] [inst : Module R₃ M₃] [inst : Module S₃ M₃] [inst : SMulCommClass R₃ S₃ M₃] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul S₃ M₃] {σ₁₃ : R →+* R₃} [inst : ContinuousAdd M₃] :
                                                                                Module S₃ (M →SL[σ₁₃] M₃)
                                                                                Equations
                                                                                • ContinuousLinearMap.module = Module.mk (_ : ∀ (x x_1 : S₃) (x_2 : M →SL[σ₁₃] M₃), (x + x_1) • x_2 = x • x_2 + x_1 • x_2) (_ : ∀ (x : M →SL[σ₁₃] M₃), 0 • x = 0)

                                                                                      source
                                                                                      def ContinuousLinearMap.smulRightₗ {R : Type u_1} {S : Type u_2} {T : Type u_3} {M : Type u_4} {M₂ : Type u_5} [inst : Semiring R] [inst : Semiring S] [inst : Semiring T] [inst : Module R S] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : Module S M₂] [inst : IsScalarTower R S M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace S] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : ContinuousSMul S M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : ContinuousAdd M₂] [inst : Module T M₂] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul T M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass R T M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass S T M₂] (c : M →L[R] S) :
                                                                                      M₂ →ₗ[T] M →L[R] M₂

                                                                                      Given c : E →L[𝕜] 𝕜, c.smulRightₗ is the linear map from F to E →L[𝕜] F sending f to fun e => c e • f. See also ContinuousLinearMap.smulRightL.

                                                                                        ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.smulRightₗ c) = ContinuousLinearMap.smulRight c
                                                                                        source
                                                                                        instance ContinuousLinearMap.algebra {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] {M₂ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M₂] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul R M₂] :
                                                                                        Algebra R (M₂ →L[R] M₂)
                                                                                        Equations
                                                                                        • One or more equations did not get rendered due to their size.
                                                                                        source
                                                                                        def ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars {A : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : Ring A] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module A M] [inst : Module A M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] (R : Type u_4) [inst : Ring R] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : LinearMap.CompatibleSMul M M₂ R A] (f : M →L[A] M₂) :
                                                                                        M →L[R] M₂

                                                                                        If A is an R-algebra, then a continuous A-linear map can be interpreted as a continuous R-linear map. We assume LinearMap.CompatibleSMul M M₂ R A to match assumptions of LinearMap.map_smul_of_tower.

                                                                                        Equations
                                                                                        • ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R f = ContinuousLinearMap.mk (↑R ↑f)
                                                                                        Instances For
                                                                                          source
                                                                                          @[simp]
                                                                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_restrictScalars {A : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : Ring A] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module A M] [inst : Module A M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] {R : Type u_4} [inst : Ring R] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : LinearMap.CompatibleSMul M M₂ R A] (f : M →L[A] M₂) :
                                                                                          ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R f) = ↑R ↑f
                                                                                          source
                                                                                          @[simp]
                                                                                          theorem ContinuousLinearMap.coe_restrictScalars' {A : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : Ring A] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module A M] [inst : Module A M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] {R : Type u_4} [inst : Ring R] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : LinearMap.CompatibleSMul M M₂ R A] (f : M →L[A] M₂) :
                                                                                          ↑(ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R f) = ↑f

                                                                                          ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R 0 = 0

                                                                                          ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R (f + g) = ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R f + ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R g

                                                                                          ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R (-f) = -ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R f

                                                                                          ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R (c • f) = c • ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars R f

                                                                                          def ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalarsₗ (A : Type u_1) (M : Type u_2) (M₂ : Type u_3) [inst : Ring A] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module A M] [inst : Module A M₂] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] (R : Type u_4) [inst : Ring R] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : LinearMap.CompatibleSMul M M₂ R A] (S : Type u_5) [inst : Ring S] [inst : Module S M₂] [inst : ContinuousConstSMul S M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass A S M₂] [inst : SMulCommClass R S M₂] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M₂] :
                                                                                          (M →L[A] M₂) →ₗ[S] M →L[R] M₂

                                                                                          ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars as a LinearMap. See also ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalarsL.

                                                                                              Coe (M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂)

                                                                                              Coerce continuous linear equivs to continuous linear maps.

                                                                                              def ContinuousLinearEquiv.toHomeomorph {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (e : M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) :
                                                                                              M₁ ≃ₜ M₂

                                                                                              A continuous linear equivalence induces a homeomorphism.

                                                                                              Equations
                                                                                              • ContinuousLinearEquiv.toHomeomorph e = Homeomorph.mk (LinearEquiv.toEquiv e.toLinearEquiv)

                                                                                                theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.map_eq_zero_iff {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (e : M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) {x : M₁} :
                                                                                                ↑e x = 0 ↔ x = 0
                                                                                                source
                                                                                                theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.continuous {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (e : M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) :
                                                                                                Continuous ↑e
                                                                                                source
                                                                                                theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.continuousOn {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (e : M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) {s : Set M₁} :

                                                                                                theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.continuousAt {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (e : M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) {x : M₁} :

                                                                                                ContinuousOn (↑e ∘ f) s ↔ ContinuousOn f s

                                                                                                theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.ext₁ {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : TopologicalSpace R₁] {f : R₁ ≃L[R₁] M₁} {g : R₁ ≃L[R₁] M₁} (h : ↑f 1 = ↑g 1) :
                                                                                                f = g

                                                                                                An extensionality lemma for R ≃L[R] M.

                                                                                                source
                                                                                                def ContinuousLinearEquiv.refl (R₁ : Type u_1) [inst : Semiring R₁] (M₁ : Type u_2) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] :
                                                                                                M₁ ≃L[R₁] M₁

                                                                                                            theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.apply_symm_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (e : M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (c : M₂) :
                                                                                                            ↑e (↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm e) c) = c
                                                                                                            source
                                                                                                            @[simp]

                                                                                                            def ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfInverse {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (f₁ : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (f₂ : M₂ →SL[σ₂₁] M₁) (h₁ : Function.LeftInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) (h₂ : Function.RightInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) :
                                                                                                            M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂

                                                                                                            Create a ContinuousLinearEquiv from two ContinuousLinearMaps that are inverse of each other.

                                                                                                            Equations
                                                                                                            • One or more equations did not get rendered due to their size.

                                                                                                              theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfInverse_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (f₁ : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (f₂ : M₂ →SL[σ₂₁] M₁) (h₁ : Function.LeftInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) (h₂ : Function.RightInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) (x : M₁) :
                                                                                                              ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfInverse f₁ f₂ h₁ h₂) x = ↑f₁ x
