                                                                                                              @[simp]
                                                                                                              theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm_equivOfInverse {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {M₁ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] (f₁ : M₁ →SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (f₂ : M₂ →SL[σ₂₁] M₁) (h₁ : Function.LeftInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) (h₂ : Function.RightInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) :
                                                                                                              ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm (ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfInverse f₁ f₂ h₁ h₂) = ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfInverse f₂ f₁ h₂ h₁
                                                                                                              source
                                                                                                              instance ContinuousLinearEquiv.automorphismGroup {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] (M₁ : Type u_2) [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] :
                                                                                                              Group (M₁ ≃L[R₁] M₁)

                                                                                                              The continuous linear equivalences from M to itself form a group under composition.

                                                                                                              Equations
                                                                                                              • ContinuousLinearEquiv.automorphismGroup M₁ = Group.mk (_ : ∀ (f : M₁ ≃L[R₁] M₁), f⁻¹ * f = 1)
                                                                                                              source
                                                                                                              def ContinuousLinearEquiv.ulift {R₁ : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R₁] {M₁ : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] :
                                                                                                              ULift M₁ ≃L[R₁] M₁

                                                                                                              The continuous linear equivalence between ULift M₁ and M₁.

                                                                                                              Equations
                                                                                                              • One or more equations did not get rendered due to their size.
                                                                                                              Instances For
                                                                                                                source
                                                                                                                @[simp]
                                                                                                                theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.arrowCongrEquiv_symm_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} {R₃ : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] [inst : Semiring R₃] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {σ₂₃ : R₂ →+* R₃} {σ₁₃ : R₁ →+* R₃} [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₁₂ σ₂₃ σ₁₃] {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_6} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] {M₄ : Type u_7} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₄] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₄] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : Module R₃ M₃] {R₄ : Type u_8} [inst : Semiring R₄] [inst : Module R₄ M₄] {σ₃₄ : R₃ →+* R₄} {σ₄₃ : R₄ →+* R₃} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₃₄ σ₄₃] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₄₃ σ₃₄] {σ₂₄ : R₂ →+* R₄} {σ₁₄ : R₁ →+* R₄} [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₂₁ σ₁₄ σ₂₄] [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₂₄ σ₄₃ σ₂₃] [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₁₃ σ₃₄ σ₁₄] (e₁₂ : M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (e₄₃ : M₄ ≃SL[σ₄₃] M₃) (f : M₂ →SL[σ₂₃] M₃) :
                                                                                                                ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.arrowCongrEquiv e₁₂ e₄₃).symm f = ContinuousLinearMap.comp (↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm e₄₃)) (ContinuousLinearMap.comp f ↑e₁₂)
                                                                                                                source
                                                                                                                @[simp]
                                                                                                                theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.arrowCongrEquiv_apply {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} {R₃ : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] [inst : Semiring R₃] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {σ₂₃ : R₂ →+* R₃} {σ₁₃ : R₁ →+* R₃} [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₁₂ σ₂₃ σ₁₃] {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_6} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] {M₄ : Type u_7} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₄] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₄] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : Module R₃ M₃] {R₄ : Type u_8} [inst : Semiring R₄] [inst : Module R₄ M₄] {σ₃₄ : R₃ →+* R₄} {σ₄₃ : R₄ →+* R₃} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₃₄ σ₄₃] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₄₃ σ₃₄] {σ₂₄ : R₂ →+* R₄} {σ₁₄ : R₁ →+* R₄} [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₂₁ σ₁₄ σ₂₄] [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₂₄ σ₄₃ σ₂₃] [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₁₃ σ₃₄ σ₁₄] (e₁₂ : M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (e₄₃ : M₄ ≃SL[σ₄₃] M₃) (f : M₁ →SL[σ₁₄] M₄) :
                                                                                                                ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.arrowCongrEquiv e₁₂ e₄₃) f = ContinuousLinearMap.comp (↑e₄₃) (ContinuousLinearMap.comp f ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm e₁₂))
                                                                                                                source
                                                                                                                def ContinuousLinearEquiv.arrowCongrEquiv {R₁ : Type u_1} {R₂ : Type u_2} {R₃ : Type u_3} [inst : Semiring R₁] [inst : Semiring R₂] [inst : Semiring R₃] {σ₁₂ : R₁ →+* R₂} {σ₂₁ : R₂ →+* R₁} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₁₂ σ₂₁] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₂₁ σ₁₂] {σ₂₃ : R₂ →+* R₃} {σ₁₃ : R₁ →+* R₃} [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₁₂ σ₂₃ σ₁₃] {M₁ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₁] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₁] {M₂ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] {M₃ : Type u_6} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₃] {M₄ : Type u_7} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₄] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₄] [inst : Module R₁ M₁] [inst : Module R₂ M₂] [inst : Module R₃ M₃] {R₄ : Type u_8} [inst : Semiring R₄] [inst : Module R₄ M₄] {σ₃₄ : R₃ →+* R₄} {σ₄₃ : R₄ →+* R₃} [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₃₄ σ₄₃] [inst : RingHomInvPair σ₄₃ σ₃₄] {σ₂₄ : R₂ →+* R₄} {σ₁₄ : R₁ →+* R₄} [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₂₁ σ₁₄ σ₂₄] [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₂₄ σ₄₃ σ₂₃] [inst : RingHomCompTriple σ₁₃ σ₃₄ σ₁₄] (e₁₂ : M₁ ≃SL[σ₁₂] M₂) (e₄₃ : M₄ ≃SL[σ₄₃] M₃) :
                                                                                                                (M₁ →SL[σ₁₄] M₄) ≃ (M₂ →SL[σ₂₃] M₃)

                                                                                                                A pair of continuous (semi)linear equivalences generates an equivalence between the spaces of continuous linear maps. See also ContinuousLinearEquiv.arrowCongr.

                                                                                                                Equations
                                                                                                                • One or more equations did not get rendered due to their size.

                                                                                                                  source
                                                                                                                  def ContinuousLinearEquiv.skewProd {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] {M₃ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommGroup M₃] {M₄ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₄] [inst : AddCommGroup M₄] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : Module R M₃] [inst : Module R M₄] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M₄] (e : M ≃L[R] M₂) (e' : M₃ ≃L[R] M₄) (f : M →L[R] M₄) :
                                                                                                                  (M × M₃) ≃L[R] M₂ × M₄

                                                                                                                  Equivalence given by a block lower diagonal matrix. e and e' are diagonal square blocks, and f is a rectangular block below the diagonal.

                                                                                                                  Equations
                                                                                                                  • One or more equations did not get rendered due to their size.

                                                                                                                    ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.skewProd e e' f) x = (↑e x.fst, ↑e' x.snd + ↑f x.fst)
                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                    @[simp]
                                                                                                                    theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.skewProd_symm_apply {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] {M₃ : Type u_4} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₃] [inst : AddCommGroup M₃] {M₄ : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₄] [inst : AddCommGroup M₄] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : Module R M₃] [inst : Module R M₄] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M₄] (e : M ≃L[R] M₂) (e' : M₃ ≃L[R] M₄) (f : M →L[R] M₄) (x : M₂ × M₄) :
                                                                                                                    ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm (ContinuousLinearEquiv.skewProd e e' f)) x = (↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm e) x.fst, ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm e') (x.snd - ↑f (↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm e) x.fst)))

                                                                                                                    ↑e (-x) = -↑e x

                                                                                                                    The next theorems cover the identification between M ≃L[𝕜] Mand the group of units of the ring M →L[R] M.

                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                        def ContinuousLinearEquiv.unitsEquiv (R : Type u_1) [inst : Ring R] (M : Type u_2) [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] :
                                                                                                                        (M →L[R] M)ˣ ≃* M ≃L[R] M

                                                                                                                        The units of the algebra of continuous R-linear endomorphisms of M is multiplicatively equivalent to the type of continuous linear equivalences between M and itself.

                                                                                                                            source
                                                                                                                            def ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfRightInverse {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M] (f₁ : M →L[R] M₂) (f₂ : M₂ →L[R] M) (h : Function.RightInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) :
                                                                                                                            M ≃L[R] M₂ × { x // x ∈ LinearMap.ker f₁ }

                                                                                                                            A pair of continuous linear maps such that f₁ ∘ f₂ = id generates a continuous linear equivalence e between M and M₂ × f₁.ker such that (e x).2 = x for x ∈ f₁.ker, (e x).1 = f₁ x, and (e (f₂ y)).2 = 0. The map is given by e x = (f₁ x, x - f₂ (f₁ x)).

                                                                                                                            Equations
                                                                                                                            • One or more equations did not get rendered due to their size.
                                                                                                                            Instances For

                                                                                                                              @[simp]

                                                                                                                              (↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfRightInverse f₁ f₂ h) x).fst = ↑f₁ x
                                                                                                                              source

                                                                                                                              theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.snd_equivOfRightInverse {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M] (f₁ : M →L[R] M₂) (f₂ : M₂ →L[R] M) (h : Function.RightInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) (x : M) :
                                                                                                                              ↑(↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfRightInverse f₁ f₂ h) x).snd = x - ↑f₂ (↑f₁ x)
                                                                                                                              source
                                                                                                                              @[simp]
                                                                                                                              theorem ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfRightInverse_symm_apply {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M] (f₁ : M →L[R] M₂) (f₂ : M₂ →L[R] M) (h : Function.RightInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) (y : M₂ × { x // x ∈ LinearMap.ker f₁ }) :
                                                                                                                              ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm (ContinuousLinearEquiv.equivOfRightInverse f₁ f₂ h)) y = ↑f₂ y.fst + ↑y.snd
                                                                                                                              source
                                                                                                                              def ContinuousLinearEquiv.funUnique (ι : Type u_1) (R : Type u_2) (M : Type u_3) [inst : Unique ι] [inst : Semiring R] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] :
                                                                                                                              (ι → M) ≃L[R] M

                                                                                                                              If ι has a unique element, then ι → M is continuously linear equivalent to M.

                                                                                                                              Equations
                                                                                                                              • ContinuousLinearEquiv.funUnique ι R M = let src := Homeomorph.funUnique ι M; ContinuousLinearEquiv.mk (LinearEquiv.funUnique ι R M)

                                                                                                                                ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.funUnique ι R M) = Function.eval default

                                                                                                                                ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.piFinTwo R M) = fun f => (f 0, f 1)

                                                                                                                                ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm (ContinuousLinearEquiv.piFinTwo R M)) = fun p => Fin.cons p.fst (Fin.cons p.snd finZeroElim)

                                                                                                                                ((i : Fin 2) → M i) ≃L[R] M 0 × M 1

                                                                                                                                  source
                                                                                                                                  def ContinuousLinearEquiv.finTwoArrow (R : Type u_1) (M : Type u_2) [inst : Semiring R] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M] :
                                                                                                                                  (Fin 2 → M) ≃L[R] M × M

                                                                                                                                  Continuous linear equivalence between vectors in M² = Fin 2 → M and M × M.

                                                                                                                                  Equations
                                                                                                                                  • ContinuousLinearEquiv.finTwoArrow R M = let src := ContinuousLinearEquiv.piFinTwo R fun x => M; ContinuousLinearEquiv.mk (LinearEquiv.finTwoArrow R M)
                                                                                                                                  Instances For
                                                                                                                                    source
                                                                                                                                    noncomputable def ContinuousLinearMap.inverse {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : Semiring R] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] :
                                                                                                                                    (M →L[R] M₂) → M₂ →L[R] M

                                                                                                                                    Introduce a function inverse from M →L[R] M₂ to M₂ →L[R] M, which sends f to f.symm if f is a continuous linear equivalence and to 0 otherwise. This definition is somewhat ad hoc, but one needs a fully (rather than partially) defined inverse function for some purposes, including for calculus.

                                                                                                                                    Equations
                                                                                                                                    • ContinuousLinearMap.inverse f = if h : ∃ e, ↑e = f then ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm (Classical.choose h)) else 0
                                                                                                                                    Instances For
                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                      @[simp]
                                                                                                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.inverse_equiv {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : Semiring R] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] (e : M ≃L[R] M₂) :
                                                                                                                                      ContinuousLinearMap.inverse ↑e = ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm e)

                                                                                                                                      By definition, if f is invertible then inverse f = f.symm.

                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                      @[simp]
                                                                                                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.inverse_non_equiv {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : Semiring R] [inst : AddCommMonoid M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : AddCommMonoid M] [inst : Module R M] (f : M →L[R] M₂) (h : ¬∃ e', ↑e' = f) :
                                                                                                                                      ContinuousLinearMap.inverse f = 0

                                                                                                                                      By definition, if f is not invertible then inverse f = 0.

                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                      @[simp]
                                                                                                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.ring_inverse_equiv {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : Ring R] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] (e : M ≃L[R] M) :
                                                                                                                                      Ring.inverse ↑e = ContinuousLinearMap.inverse ↑e
                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.to_ring_inverse {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : Ring R] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module R M₂] (e : M ≃L[R] M₂) (f : M →L[R] M₂) :
                                                                                                                                      ContinuousLinearMap.inverse f = ContinuousLinearMap.comp (Ring.inverse (ContinuousLinearMap.comp (↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm e)) f)) ↑(ContinuousLinearEquiv.symm e)

                                                                                                                                      The function ContinuousLinearEquiv.inverse can be written in terms of Ring.inverse for the ring of self-maps of the domain.

                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                      theorem ContinuousLinearMap.ring_inverse_eq_map_inverse {R : Type u_2} {M : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : Ring R] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] :
                                                                                                                                      Ring.inverse = ContinuousLinearMap.inverse
                                                                                                                                      source
                                                                                                                                      def Submodule.ClosedComplemented {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] (p : Submodule R M) :
                                                                                                                                      Prop

                                                                                                                                      A submodule p is called complemented if there exists a continuous projection M →ₗ[R] p.

                                                                                                                                      Equations
                                                                                                                                      • Submodule.ClosedComplemented p = ∃ f, ∀ (x : { x // x ∈ p }), ↑f ↑x = x
                                                                                                                                      Instances For
                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem Submodule.ClosedComplemented.has_closed_complement {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] {p : Submodule R M} [inst : T1Space { x // x ∈ p }] (h : Submodule.ClosedComplemented p) :
                                                                                                                                        ∃ q x, IsCompl p q
                                                                                                                                        source
                                                                                                                                        theorem Submodule.ClosedComplemented.isClosed {R : Type u_2} [inst : Ring R] {M : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] [inst : Module R M] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M] [inst : T1Space M] {p : Submodule R M} (h : Submodule.ClosedComplemented p) :
                                                                                                                                        IsClosed ↑p
                                                                                                                                        source

                                                                                                                                        Submodule.ClosedComplemented ⊥

                                                                                                                                        theorem ContinuousLinearMap.closedComplemented_ker_of_rightInverse {R : Type u_1} [inst : Ring R] {M : Type u_2} [inst : TopologicalSpace M] [inst : AddCommGroup M] {M₂ : Type u_3} [inst : TopologicalSpace M₂] [inst : AddCommGroup M₂] [inst : Module R M] [inst : Module R M₂] [inst : TopologicalAddGroup M] (f₁ : M →L[R] M₂) (f₂ : M₂ →L[R] M) (h : Function.RightInverse ↑f₂ ↑f₁) :
                                                                                                                                        Submodule.ClosedComplemented (LinearMap.ker f₁)
